definition: state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: He was a chivalrous person, but was more like a loyal minister.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个义士，但更是一位忠臣。

sentences.english: When did the United Empire Loyalists come to Canada?
sentences.chinese: 联合帝国忠臣何时来到加拿大？

sentences.english: The Queen conferred a noble title on her faithful minister.
sentences.chinese: 女王将贵族称号授予其忠臣。

sentences.english: In ancient times, loyal officials were always punished after directly speaking out against the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 古代，忠臣往往因为直言规谏君王而遭受处罚。

sentences.english: He is a loyal official who has made some great contributions.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位屡建功勋的屏藩忠臣。

definition: a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
official who dares speak frankly before the emperor
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
